page.title: 08A.V.C.S. AMMANFORD
page.content: The Amman Valley Comprehensive is one of the largest in Dyfed, having 1539 pupils. The 91 members of staff offer a wide range of study subjects ranging from pottery to geology, German to Spanish and Automobile Mechanics to child care! There is a ten stream entry in form one. Only one group is offered tuition through the medium of Welsh; History, Geography and Religious Education are taught in Welsh to that one group to 'O' Level. English, Welsh, Maths and one science subject are compulsory to all pupils until the sixth form. A wide span of examination levels is catered for - 'O', C.S,'A' and S levels and City and Guilds. The school has an active social life taking part in numerous quizzes, Carol Concert, Eisteddfodau, TV.Programmes, Charity events and annual drama.
